summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 8097, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-first Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from East Jefferson Street to the north line of Walla Walla Addition, by parking, curbing and concrete sidewalking the same in conformity with the following plan: Parking strips between street margin and sidewalk to be two feet wide; sidewalks to be concrete and six feet wide; parking strips between sidewalk and roadway to be six feet wide, provided the cost of such crossings as hall be constructed between curbs shall be paid from the general fund, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
